column4: Seattle police find no explosives after Amazon HQ threat
column5: SEATTLE Seattle police searched for explosives at Amazon.com's headquarters after a threatening letter was found at a company building just north of the city's downtown district  but found nothing  authorities said on Monday.

The enlarged  group would benefit from revenue and cost synergies  including the recovery of  revenues that are currently lost to mobile substitution and the upselling  potential of quad-play  bundling mobile with its fixed voice

column4: NYSE to eliminate fees for some retail stock orders
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 16 Intercontinental Exchange Inc's  NYSE Group unit said on Tuesday it would eliminate the fees the exchange operator charges for certain retail stock orders in an effort to take back business from over-the-counter trading platforms.

column4: IHG agrees $430 mln acquisition of boutique Kimpton Hotels
column5: LONDON InterContinental Hotels Group  one of the world's largest hoteliers  has agreed to buy U.S.-focused Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants for $430 million to boost its exposure to the faster-growing boutique hotel sector.

column4: UPDATE 4-Itaú's Setubal eyes Banamex as potential entry to Mexico
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 16 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA   Latin America's largest bank by market value  wants to enter the Mexican retail banking market and is eyeing Grupo Financiero Banamex SA as a potential way in  Chief Executive Officer Roberto Egydio Setubal said on Tuesday.

column4: Brazil's Itaú to keep disposing of non-core insurance units
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 16 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA will continue to sell insurance assets that are not strategically key to Brazil's most profitable bank  Chief Executive Officer Roberto Setubal said on Tuesday.

column4: Itaú has no plans for overseas acquisition  executive says
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 16 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA  Latin America's largest bank by market value  has no immediate plans to buy a rival overseas as an ongoing decline in Brazil's currency is making foreign acquisitions more expensive  a senior executive said on Tuesday.

column4: Galapagos loses partner on inflammatory bowel drug
column5: BRUSSELS Belgian biotech group Galapagos said on Tuesday that its research partner Janssen Pharmaceutica  a unit of Johnson & Johnson  had pulled out of a program to develop a new drug to treat bowel disease.

column5: Investment bank Jefferies Group LLC  owned by Leucadia National Corp   said it was in talks to sell its commodities and financial derivatives brokerage  which has been struggling with high costs and falling fees.

column5: Dec 16 Investment bank Jefferies Group LLC  owned by Leucadia National Corp  reported a quarterly loss and said it was exploring strategic alternatives for its futures-brokerage unit.

column4: U.S. startup sues France's Orange over social calling app: FT
column5: French telecom group Orange SA has been sued in California by San Francisco-based startup Telesocial over an application that lets users make phone calls via their Facebook profiles  the Financial Times reported.

column4: Orange executive sees BT/EE deal closing by early 2016
column5: PARIS British telecoms group BT's  plan to buy UK mobile operator EE for 12.5 billion pounds ($19.7 billion) should be completed by end-2015 or early 2016  said a senior executive of French group Orange  which owns half of the business.

column4: Cost of borrowing Petrobras shares doubles on corruption scandal
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 16 The cost of borrowing common shares of Petróleo Brasileiro SA in Brazilian equity markets more than doubled over the past month as investors bet that a corruption scandal engulfing the state-run oil producer will further depress its stock.

column4: Brazil prosecutor seeks indictment against former Petrobras CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Prosecutors in Rio de Janeiro said on Tuesday that they were seeking to indict the former chief executive officer of Brazilian state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  and a leading local construction and engineering firm for fraud.

column4: Progressive to take controlling stake in ARX Holding for $875 million
column5: Progressive Corp   a provider of auto insurance products  said it would acquire a controlling stake in property insurer ARX Holding Corp for $875 million in cash.

column5: Dec 16 Progressive Corp  a provider of auto insurance products  said it would acquire a controlling stake in property insurer ARX Holding Corp for $875 million in cash.

column4: Rockwell Collins executive sees big market in Boeing 777 retrofits
column5: NEW YORK Rockwell Collins Inc  sees a large opportunity to retrofit current-generation Boeing Co  777 aircraft with heads-up cockpit displays it is developing for the next-generation 777X  a senior executive told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: Cerberus buys more Europe property assets with RBS  NAB deals
column5: LONDON/SYDNEY U.S. private equity firm Cerberus snapped up billions of pounds of loans in Ireland and Britain in a pair of deals on Tuesday  reinforcing its position as one of the biggest buyers of European property assets at knock-down prices.

column5: LONDON Britain's Royal Bank of Scotland said on Tuesday it still had work to do to build up its defenses against potential losses after it narrowly passed a Bank of England stress test.

column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 16 U.S. wireless carrier Sprint Corp is expected to face a $105 million fine from the Federal Communications Commission in coming weeks over unauthorized charges on customers' cellphone bills  a practice known as cramming  according to FCC officials.

column5: Apache Corp was not in breach of contract in a lawsuit brought by Houston-based oil and gas producer W&T Offshore Inc in 2011  a federal jury found on Monday  according to a court filing.
